pageContext.claim: “I've always said 71 billion, but Mexico were 130 billion. That's a real number because nobody includes the VAT tax. Nobody even knows what about taxes, but Mexico charges a 16% VAT tax.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump, when he says $71 billion, is citing figures for trades in goods, but not including services. The United States had a trade deficit of $56 billion in 2016 with Mexico when services are included. And then he doubled the number for some reason.
